item.description: @Laughing_Man Exactly. Even though it's an older camera and lens, the E mount makes it usable with more modern glass. Much cheaper at this point to get some more life out of it than to simply replace it. üòâ

item.description: @ashishmohta @ThatBlairGuy Teslas and other EVs do the same: Charge quickly from 0% to around 75 / 80. Then it gets harder to cram more electrons in the limited space so the charge slows down. The ‚Äúunder-charge‚Äù rule isn‚Äôt to protect from over-charging; it‚Äôs to prevent long-term battery degradation.
item.source:markdown: @ashishmohta @ThatBlairGuy Teslas and other EVs do the same: Charge quickly from 0% to around 75 / 80. Then it gets harder to cram more electrons in the limited space so the charge slows down. The ‚Äúunder-charge‚Äù rule isn‚Äôt to protect from over-charging; it‚Äôs to prevent long-term battery degradation.

item.description: @ashishmohta Nope, this applies to any EV. If you let the battery sit with a full charge, over time it‚Äôs total capacity is lowered over time.
item.source:markdown: @ashishmohta Nope, this applies to any EV. If you let the battery sit with a full charge, over time it‚Äôs total capacity is lowered over time.

item.description: ‚ÄúGood battery hygiene is an essential part of keeping an EV running. Just like an oil change is for an internal combustion engine car.‚Äù <‚Äî This! We never charge beyond 85% or so unless we know we‚Äôre going on a long trip. Then we fill to 100% and go. https://t.co/79sOJzTX7B
item.source:markdown: ‚ÄúGood battery hygiene is an essential part of keeping an EV running. Just like an oil change is for an internal combustion engine car.‚Äù <‚Äî This! We never charge beyond 85% or so *unless* we know we‚Äôre going on a long trip. *Then* we fill to 100% and go. https://t.co/79sOJzTX7B
